medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe Cushing’s disease and locally aggressive pituitary tumor.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with severe Cushing’s disease, marked hypokalemia, and elevated UFC levels. Symptoms began before the diagnosis of the pituitary tumor, developing into a carcinoma with widespread liver metastases 16 months after initial presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A history of colon carcinoma and Lynch syndrome (MSH2 mutation).
medical_history.family_history: One first-degree relative had colon carcinoma.
